oai_dc:dc.dc:title: APPLICATION OF QUADRATIC DIFFERENTIAL FORMS TO DESIGNING LINEAR CONTROLLERS FOR NONLINEARITIES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PENDHARKAR, I
PILLAI, HK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: SYSTEMS
Nonlinear systems
QDFs
storage functions
Lyapunov functions
absolute stability
behaviors
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We consider the following problem: given a nonlinear system (possibly with memory), parametrize a class of linear systems that can be interconnected (through fairly general interconnection constraints) with the nonlinear system to yield a stable autonomous system. We address this problem in a behavioral theoretic setting by constructing Quadratic Differential Forms (QDFs) called storage functions associated with the linear system.
